solution_line_template: If she drives {miles_today} miles today, the car will have consumed {gas_per_mile}*{miles_today} = <<{miles_today}*{gas_per_mile}={gas_today}>>{gas_today} gallons of gas.

Tomorrow, if she drives {more_miles_tomorrow} more miles, the total distance will be {more_miles_tomorrow}+{miles_today} = <<{more_miles_tomorrow}+{miles_today}={miles_tomorrow}>>{miles_tomorrow} miles.
The fuel consumption by the car tomorrow is {gas_per_mile}*{miles_tomorrow} = <<{gas_per_mile}*{miles_tomorrow}={gas_tomorrow}>>{gas_tomorrow} gallons.
The car's total fuel consumption in the two days is {gas_tomorrow}+{gas_today} = <<{gas_tomorrow}+{gas_today}={total_gas}>>{total_gas} gallons.
